meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Arabs Fear Seizures Of East Jerusalem Land The Israeli government secretly approved a measure last summer allowing it to seize land in East Jerusalem owned by Palestinians who live elsewhere. A lawyer for the Palestinians said hundreds of property owners could be affected.
PAGE A4

Hurdles for Cabinet Choices Trying to show they remain a force despite reduced numbers, Senate Democrats threatened hurdles for President Bush's cabinet choices and expressed misgivings about Social Security changes.
PAGE A17
Kennedy Won't Run in State Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the son of the onetime senator from New York, said he had decided not to run for state attorney general.
PAGE B1
A.C.L.U. Reports Iraq Abuse The American Civil Liberties Union accused the military of not thoroughly investigating abuse of Iraqi civilians. The Army said it had aggressively investigated.
PAGE A10

Bracing for Einstein's Year The 100th anniversary of the ''miracle year'' in which Einstein reshaped the foundations of physics is being marked by a deluge of events, including a newly invented bicycle stunt, the Einstein Flip.
PAGE F1
Conviction in Stock Case Anthony Elgindy, a well-known figure in the world of penny stocks, was found guilty on charges that he used confidential F.B.I. information to profit illegally in the market.
PAGE C1
Culinary Figure Admits Theft The former president of the James Beard Foundation pleaded guilty to stealing tens of thousands of dollars from the culinary group.
PAGE B1

Arabs Fear Seizures Of East Jerusalem Land The Israeli government secretly approved a measure last summer allowing it to seize land in East Jerusalem owned by Palestinians who live elsewhere. A lawyer for the Palestinians said hundreds of property owners could be affected.
PAGE A4

Hurdles for Cabinet Choices Trying to show they remain a force despite reduced numbers, Senate Democrats threatened hurdles for President Bush's cabinet choices and expressed misgivings about Social Security changes.
PAGE A17
Kennedy Won't Run in State Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the son of the onetime senator from New York, said he had decided not to run for state attorney general.
PAGE B1
A.C.L.U. Reports Iraq Abuse The American Civil Liberties Union accused the military of not thoroughly investigating abuse of Iraqi civilians. The Army said it had aggressively investigated.
PAGE A10

Bracing for Einstein's Year The 100th anniversary of the ''miracle year'' in which Einstein reshaped the foundations of physics is being marked by a deluge of events, including a newly invented bicycle stunt, the Einstein Flip.
PAGE F1
Conviction in Stock Case Anthony Elgindy, a well-known figure in the world of penny stocks, was found guilty on charges that he used confidential F.B.I. information to profit illegally in the market.
PAGE C1
Culinary Figure Admits Theft The former president of the James Beard Foundation pleaded guilty to stealing tens of thousands of dollars from the culinary group.
PAGE B1
